title: Google\Cloud\Batch\V1\Volume
name: Volume
description:
Volume and mount parameters to be associated with a TaskSpec. A TaskSpec might describe zero, one, or multiple volumes to be mounted as part of the task.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.batch.v1.Volume

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.nfs
params.description: An NFS source for the volume (could be a Filestore, for example).

params.name: data.gcs
params.description: A Google Cloud Storage source for the volume.

params.name: data.mount_options
params.description: Mount options For Google Cloud Storage, mount options are the global options supported by gcsfuse tool. Batch will use them to mount the volume with the following command: "gcsfuse [global options] bucket mountpoint". For PD, NFS, mount options are these supported by /etc/fstab. Batch will use Fstab to mount such volumes. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Fstab

methods.description:
Mount path for the volume, e.g. /mnt/share

methods.name: getMountOptions
methods.description:
Mount options For Google Cloud Storage, mount options are the global options supported by gcsfuse tool. Batch will use them to mount the volume with the following command: "gcsfuse [global options] bucket mountpoint".

For PD, NFS, mount options are these supported by /etc/fstab. Batch will use Fstab to mount such volumes. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Fstab

Generated from protobuf field repeated string mount_options = 5;

methods.name: setMountOptions
methods.description:

For PD, NFS, mount options are these supported by /etc/fstab. Batch will use Fstab to mount such volumes. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Fstab

Generated from protobuf field repeated string mount_options = 5;
